what: Compute entropy of a categorical variable — entropy
title: Compute entropy of a categorical variable — entropy
text: Computes entropy categorical variable, optional normalisation.

title: Compute entropy of a categorical variable — entropy
Compute entropy of a categorical variable — entropy
text: x character vector representing observed categorical values. normalise Logical. TRUE, entropy normalised range 0 1. FALSE, raw Shannon entropy returned.

title: Compute entropy of a categorical variable — entropy
text: numeric value representing entropy x.

what: Filter ancestries by generation threshold — filter_alpha_by_kappa
title: Filter ancestries by generation threshold — filter_alpha_by_kappa
text: Filters alpha values outbreaker_chains object based specified threshold kappa, removing ancestors beyond given number generations.

title: Filter ancestries by generation threshold — filter_alpha_by_kappa
Filter ancestries by generation threshold — filter_alpha_by_kappa
text: data frame class outbreaker_chains. kappa_max single integer specifying maximum allowed number generations (kappa).

title: Filter ancestries by generation threshold — filter_alpha_by_kappa
text: modified outbreaker_chains data frame alpha values filtered based kappa threshold. means value kappa greater kappa_max, corresponding alpha value set NA.

title: Filter ancestries by generation threshold — filter_alpha_by_kappa

title: Calculate accuracy of a outbreak reconstruction — get_accuracy
text: Accuracy outbreak reconstruction defined proportion correctly assigned ancestries across posterior sample.

title: Calculate accuracy of a outbreak reconstruction — get_accuracy
Calculate accuracy of a outbreak reconstruction — get_accuracy
text: est_tt list transmission trees. See get_trees. element data frame containing transmission tree columns '' ''. true_tt data frame containing true transmission tree. Columns '' '' required.

title: Calculate accuracy of a outbreak reconstruction — get_accuracy
text: numeric vector accuracy values posterior tree.

what: Compute the entropy of transmission trees — get_entropy
title: Compute the entropy of transmission trees — get_entropy
text: Computes mean entropy inferred transmission trees outbreaker2, quantifying uncertainty infected . default, entropy normalised range 0 (complete certainty) 1 (maximum uncertainty).

title: Compute the entropy of transmission trees — get_entropy
Compute the entropy of transmission trees — get_entropy
text: data frame class outbreaker_chains containing posterior samples transmission ancestries (alpha). normalise Logical. TRUE (default), entropy normalised 0 1. FALSE, raw Shannon entropy returned.

title: Compute the entropy of transmission trees — get_entropy
text: numeric value representing mean entropy transmission trees across posterior samples.

title: Compute the entropy of transmission trees — get_entropy
text: Entropy measures uncertainty inferred infectors across posterior samples. computed : $$H(X) = -\sum p_i \log p_i$$ \(p_i\) proportion times infector inferred case. normalise = TRUE, entropy scaled maximum possible value, \( K\), \(K\) number distinct inferred infectors: $$H^*(X) = \frac{H(X)}{\log K}$$ ensures values range 0 1, : 0 complete certainty — infector inferred across samples. 1 maximum uncertainty — infectors equally likely.

title: Compute the entropy of transmission trees — get_entropy
code: # High entropy out <- data.frame(alpha_1 = sample(c("2", "3"), 100, replace = TRUE),                   alpha_2 = sample(c("1", "3"), 100, replace = TRUE)) class(out) <- c("outbreaker_chains", class(out)) get_entropy(out) #> [1] 1  # Low entropy out <- data.frame(alpha_1 = sample(c("2", "3"), 100, replace = TRUE, prob = c(0.9, 0.1)),                   alpha_2 = sample(c("1", "3"), 100, replace = TRUE, prob = c(0.9, 0.1))) class(out) <- c("outbreaker_chains", class(out)) get_entropy(out) #> [1] 0.54

title: Extract posterior transmission trees — get_trees
text: Generates list data frames representing posterior transmission trees outbreaker_chains object. tree represented data frame '' '' columns, optionally includes additional columns.

title: Extract posterior transmission trees — get_trees
code: get_trees(out, ids, kappa = FALSE, t_inf = FALSE, ...)

title: Extract posterior transmission trees — get_trees
text: data frame class outbreaker_chains. ids character integer vector case IDs original linelist. kappa logical indicating whether include kappa values output. Default FALSE. t_inf logical indicating whether include infection times (t_inf) output. Default FALSE. ... Additional named vectors original linelist include columns (e.g., loc = linelist$location).

title: Extract posterior transmission trees — get_trees
text: list data frames. data frame contains '' '' columns, optionally includes kappa, t_inf, additional columns.

title: Extract posterior transmission trees — get_trees
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ get_trees(out, ids = ids, group = group, dates = dates) } # }

title: Compute the transmission table — ttable
text: Generates contingency table given '' '' vectors.

title: Compute the transmission table — ttable
Compute the transmission table — ttable
text: vector infectors. vector infectees. levels Optional. vector levels factors. Defaults unique, sorted values '' ''. ... Additional arguments passed 'table' function.

title: Compute the transmission table — ttable
text: contingency table representing counts infectors (rows) infectees (columns) group (level).

title: Compute the transmission table — ttable
code: from <- c("A", "A", NA, "C", "C", "C") to <- c("A", "B", "B", "C", "C", "C") ttable(from, to) #>     to #> from A B C #>    A 1 1 0 #>    B 0 0 0 #>    C 0 0 3
